A-B, tekn. sakk. i ind:komm. krigsind :avd. sed. 40, led. av sjöförsv. utb :komm. ised. 42, led. av direkt, f. Gbgs navig:’sk. 41. RVO 33, RltKrO.
translated: Christiansson, Eric Theodor, director, civil engineer, Gothenburg, b. 25/4/00 in Svanshall, Jons torp, Malmöh, son of sea captain Olof Th. C. and Kristih Andersson. He graduated from Hälsingborg in 1919, earned his engineering degree from Chalmers University of Technology (shipbuilding) in 1923, and completed his engine officer course in the navy in 1923. He had practical experience at sea on sailing, steam, and motor ships from 1914-1922, worked as a draftsman and designer at A-B Lindholmen-Motala from 1924-1926, was a yard engineer and head of the new construction department and more for the same company from 1927-1931, was head engineer and manager of a shipyard in Gothenburg from 1931-1933, and became the managing director of A-B Broströms Line Agency in 1934. He was also the technical director of Broströmkoncernens' shipping companies, the managing director of A-B Bunker Oils since 1937, and the managing director of the shipping company Rederi A-B Mo'torfart, Albatross number since 1928. He was authorized to inspect ships and was a member of the board of A-B Br0'ströms Line Agency, A-B Bunkeroljor, Rederi A-B Al'batros, Halmstad's Ängb, Gothenburg's Bogsers- and Bärgn. A-B, a technical expert in the industrial commission's war industry department since 1940, a member of the naval education commission since 1942, and a member of the board of the Gothenburg navigation school in 1941. He received the Royal Order of Vasa in 1933 and the Knight of the Order of the Polar Star.

awards.name: Knight of the Order of the Polar Star
